name: Arethusa Falls

trails_config.name: Arethusa Falls Trail
trails_config.description: New Hampshire’s tallest waterfall is a must: a steep but short climb to a dramatic drop framed by cliff walls. Great after rainfall, and especially photogenic in peak foliage season.
trails_config.parking_info: Arethusa Falls Trailhead Parking, Arethusa Falls Rd (off Rt 302)

trails_config.name: Bemis Brook + Arethusa Loop
trails_config.description: The classic Crawford Notch loop: climb past cascades and pools on Bemis Brook, then tag Arethusa Falls for a two-for-one waterfall day. Expect steeper footing and slick rock—prime for experienced hikers.
trails_config.parking_info: Arethusa Falls Trailhead Parking, Arethusa Falls Rd (off Rt 302)

current_conditions.ai_summary: One of New Hampshire's premier peaks, Arethusa Falls rises to 2500 feet. It is known for its rugged terrain and panoramic vistas.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 2500 feet, Arethusa Falls is a standout peak in New Hampshire. Known for its rugged and challenging terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Arethusa Falls Trail**, a **2.9 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **local peak challenge**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

**Peak Bagging Opportunity:** Consider connecting this hike with **Ripley Falls**, which is just 1.1 miles away. Linking these peaks is a popular way to maximize your day on the trail.
